name: kittiwake
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a white and grey sea bird that lives in northern parts of the world: Kittiwakes typically breed high on sea cliffs, where they glue their nests of seaweed and mud to the narrowest ledges.
More examplesFewer examplesPuffins and gannets, guillemots and kittiwakes flock to the cliffs of Flamborough Headland near Bridlington to nest.We found a tiny peninsula with cliffs just high enough for a colony of kittiwakes.The worst affected have been birds such as the terns and kittiwakes, which feed by catching small fish near the sea surface by shallow plunge-diving.Farther down the coast we saw a huge kittiwake colony on an inland cliff.
